description.para: Makes an Event object wait, from changing into notified state.

param_note.para: Pointer which holds the value of notified state of Event object. It means waiting thread ignores puState if it is NULL. It will make sense only when this function succeeds in waiting the Event object changing into notified state.

tr.td: Function succeeds in waiting for the event object to notify.

return.para: References ECODE related help for more details

remarks.para: This member function is to make Event object wait, from changing into notified state. If Event object is not in notified state, calling thread will get into waiting state, it won't stop waiting until Event object is changed into notified state, and return from this function. If Event object is in notified state, this function returns at once. Mean while, if Event object is reset automatically, it will reset as not notified. If it is reset manually, Event object will keep notified state. Thread waiting period can be interrupted.
